reviews.text: Just so you guys know this Starbucks is claiming that they no longer except in person or orders you have to order from the app. I find no issue with that at all, but I do feel for people who don’t have smart phones although I think everybody does now but what if you don’t have the app on your phone and what if you don’t want the app Starbucks what’s going on?

This is my #1 favorite  Starbucks... the customer service is great...  when I walk in they always  greet you by name...  they definitely know their regular customers...The manager on days is so nice and all her  other baristas at this location are so nice as well. This location is the only reason why I have the starbuck app...  This location  introduced me to the Brown Sugar Oatmilk Expresso... I been hooked since ❤️It's my  favorite drink.. and when it's made right.. whew Chile I have to do my happy dance... I don't even have to tell them my order when I walk in they already know... 🙌🙌🙌🙌
Small space, helpful workers, assisted me with my online order through my phone app. Went back the next day received order quickly.

Store has terrible customer service.one of the young managers was rude and ignorant with me. I got my Uber eats order confused which I apologized she got indignant and told me if o didn’t like it call corporate!!! Now usually employees don’t get that out of hand to where they tell you to call corporate so this leaves me to believe she don’t care and she’s done this on a regular, and nothing is done about it. I would never patronize to this Starbucks I took them off my list with Uber. Uber also apologize to me for her behavior. I also told the young lady I apologize I feel that you owe me an apology. She said in a very ignorant voice. Well I’m sorry you got your order wrong. I tell you I was out done with that response.

This Starbucks used to be a corner cafe, a great place to have a coffee, watch people and enjoy the view out of the window. They’ve renovated the place and made it a pick up location. What a waste. That’s how you kill neighborhoods.

Perfect local spot with saucy sandwiches brimming with flavor! Reasonable sandwich prices and a variety of flavors. The sumac chicken was fantastic. I was prepared to give a tip and the waiter clicked past, saying “if you like it come back” which made me want to tip way more than the obligatory “couple questions for you”

Great service, management are doing a brilliant job! Ordered a Cajun chicken and buffalo chicken sandwich, both were DELICIOUS. Ended my meal with a scoop of their Italian biscuit ice cream, so great. Zabiha Halal chicken on their menu which was a massive plus considering the limited halal sandwich shops in Chicago. Will definitely be visiting again!!

Great place to take a rest at Hyde Park neighbourhood.

It’s always busy, but the service comes quick and warm.
The staff are welcoming and polite.

Small size of drink is already big enough.
Chai Latte is good, love it.
Bagel has different options- sesame, plain, and wheat.
Bagel 53 is yummy, with cream cheese and tomato.

Such a solid sandwich. We got Dutch Crunch on garlic chicken, can’t wait to come back and have another sandwich. We also got the raspberry bar. You can tell the workers and patrons love the place. Free street parking was pretty easy on a Saturday afternoon.
A quaint cafe that captures the vibrancy of Hyde Park. The owner was extremely nice and the sandwiches were halal and on-point
I love this little shop with all my little heart! Great environment ! Totally not surgical and sterile more like warm and fuzzy
good coffee and great service. Love the baristas at this student-run cafe. Shout out Kennedy!!! Get an iced white chocolate mocha with honey and cinnamon.
Tasty yummy! Oat caramel latte is my go-to! Baristas are great!

The coffee shop is really nice and has a good selection. The staff are pretty friendly and helpful, but they can also be a bit sassy if you know them personally. It's a bit expensive, but the quality is good and the atmosphere is pretty nice.
I only ordered americano coffee and the quality was ok, but the price is cheap similar to other coffee shops at UChicago. But they also sell sandwiches and sweet treats.

Remember the burger SpongeBob gave the health inspector?

You know what…..You would have thought I would have learned my lesson to not play with McDonalds but clearly I haven’t learned. On Sunday December 17th 2023 at 8:45 pm this is what I was handed……I just can’t believe it. What really makes me mad is that the person who made this LOOKED at the bread saw it was brunt and made a conscious decision to wrap it up and give to a customer like nothing happened……

Before I continue ….The young man who gave me my refund was so nice and sweet and so respectful. He was truly a gentleman and I appreciate him so much. He is too good for that place! The only one with some respect and sense (Tall young man with the waves).

But the rest y’all need to be fired! Ghetto, rude, unprofessional, disrespectful. Then the young lady with brown and blonde hair had the Audacity to say it’s not her problem……I almost forgot I was saved for a second. Idk what their location has going on but yall need to get some professional help and Gordan Ramsey. It’s fries on the floor. Now the ice crème machine is broken. Now the toaster burning food? CLOSE DOWN SHOP IMMEDIATELY! McDonald’s franchise owners make a lot of money please invest in the equipment and train your mf staff….

Had breakfast using the drive through. Got cheated out of a hash brown and there were no coffee choices except regular coffee. Drive in took the better part of 1/2 hour. Food was tasty but not worth the hassle and time

We waited an hour for our food along with many others waiting 30 plus minutes. When I went to check on our meal the manager would look at my order number and then walk away. After 3 times of this happening,  I ask how much longer and was told that they can't find my order. I asked if that meant that I don't get my food and was told yes, that's what that means. Then was told I could wait in line to get a refund. I wanted in line and requested a refund and the lady working the register said she didn't know how and had to get the manager. She then came back up and asked me what I wanted. I said you told me to wait for a refund, she then looked at my receipt and walked over and put my order together in about 1 minute. Total time was well over an hour and tons of attitude and listening to her argue with other costumers and ignore me 3 times.

Went today I got my order I asked the lady may I please get some ketchup and more ranch for the nuggets she rudely said we have no ketchup n there's ranch in the bag walked away so I asked another person and they gave me another ranch and 2 packages of ketchup, I had 2 whole meals like what is 2 ketchups gonna do,?!? like I understand the job is hard but if you don't like it I'm sure there's other ppl wanting to work like quit.
This McDonald's was AWESOME 😎...! NAE REMADE MY LATTE WITH A QUICKNESS, THE FOOD WAS GREAT, AND I WAS ABSOLUTELY IMPRESSED WITH THE SERVICE & HOW CLEAN THE RESTAURANT AND BATHROOMS ARE IS AMAZING!

The specialty latte selection and bread here are amazing! I particularly enjoyed the Cardamom Rose and Pecan Pie lattes. The grab & go sandwiches, including the Jambon Beurre and Under Pressure, were very delicious too. Note the coffee will take be a bit of wait during busy times.

Went here after the farmer's market in the 61st. Was quite busy around 11am, and is often a popular place for UChicago students. I ordered an early bird sandwich which was quite heavy and filling making it a brunch. The bread was too hard though. Would recommend every once in a while. Also, the space to dine was all packed so do not quote on the atmosphere.

I ordered the “little one&two” sandwich and a small vanilla latte. That sandwich was divine. Seasoned to perfection and assembled beautifully. It was my first visit. The crowd was definitely U of C based so it has a university cafe vibe. Only had seating for 15-20 people so most took items to go. The service seemed standard to me. Real chill. Overall, good experience. I’d comeback to try another sandwich! They also had books for purchase.
The Early Bird is the best breakfast sandwich I’ve ever had 🙌
Good coffee, cute place, atrocious vibes. Zero hospitality. Only ordered an espresso to go with no one else waiting, took forever and served lukewarm. Bizarre experience.
This Dunkin beautiful people he’s talking with friendly and nice services. Every single person please one time Visit this Dunkin I know you like it.
Ive gotten donuts twice and both times they were not fresh.
I want to highlight how great both the staff and customers are in the 7am - 9am time. I just moved to Hyde Park a month ago. I’m so thankful to have this DDs within walking distance!

There's this one black girl who has the most nasty attitude and it seems like it bothers her that I had to interrupt her texting and talking on the phone. She was more worried about her phone than the customers and still have such a bad face gestures. Never coming back here again. After 1 year I had enough of her. They need to come and train them again.

Yeah.. I won’t be coming back here. The customer service is bad and we waited 30mins for our order — and they still messed up one of our coffees. It spent like 15minutes just placing the order, actually 30mins to receive it, and another 7mins to remake the coffee. I fear I’m good in this location love.

First of all it doesn't look like this it's literally just a room where they can have two pool tables and a bunch of kids that view you're looking for is downstairs where there's no coffee also, every time I go into this place they have about 20-year-olds working there and they are the worst customer service you can tell they've never ever been taught those skills in their life the gen Z honestly most the places on this campus are ran by 20-year-olds so it's a no with no worth ethic

Solid coffee shop for studying in an upbeat environment but keeping with the older aesthetic of the university. Several pool tables if you want to take a break from studying or just want to hangout with friends. My favorite is either the cortado or london fog with oat milk. They offer several alternatives; almond, oat, and soy milk. Sometimes the pace is slow granted it is run by students but an overall friendly atmosphere if you aren’t in a rush to go anywhere.

Charming coffee shop inside University of Chicago's Reynolds Club. This place is on the second floor and is open 7 days a week with evening hours. I'm not a student, but I could tell it was a popular place to hang out and study. There is also 2 pool tables inside. My iced mocha was really good. I'll definitely be coming back.
***NOT OPEN DURING INTER TERMS OR SUMMER QUARTER.*** No A/C so folks would die, basically, if they were open.
Hard to find. No AC. The ice machine was broken.

In this dimly lit cafe, stands a woman of middling years, her mane of black hair framing a countenance that speaks of indifference. She exudes an air of proprietorship, yet her demeanor belies any sense of hospitality.

Her gaze, cold and unyielding, sweeps past those who await her attention, as if the very act of acknowledgment were beneath her station. Minutes tick by, yet she remains ensconced in her realm, indifferent to the needs of those who stand before her.

Conversations flow around her, as she engages in idle banter with others or retreats into the sanctuary of the kitchen. It is a sight to behold, the owner of the establishment shirking the duties of her station with brazen disregard.

Should one dare to confront her with the audacity of their presence, they are met with a wall of obstinate silence. The defiance in her eyes mirrors the stubbornness of her character, while her countenance bears the mark of a mind untouched by the light of intellect.

In her realm of apathy and indifference, she reigns supreme, a monarch of mediocrity. And so, True North stands as a testament to the folly of those who would dare to seek solace within its walls, only to be met with the contemptuous gaze of its negligent mistress.

Healthy smoothies 👌🏼
Delicious baked goods 😋
Convenient Print with Me printer inside the cafe 👍🏻

Went once last summer and got a green smoothie, it was alright but the texture wasn’t the smoothie texture that you would expect. Just tried to visit again this past weekend 20 mins before closing and the kitchen was closed. Smh I don’t know if this is policy or employees but it’s disappointing that they would close the kitchen up early when most of the food is simple food. I will not be back. There are several other restaurants nearby that won’t turn your dollars away.

I love this place: the tea, the sandwiches, and the staff. China breakfast tea is so full-flavored and smooth. The Godfather sandwich is so tasty, fragrant, tactile, and satisfying. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

I’ve lived in Hyde Park for years and TrueNorth Cafe never disappoints. Today I stopped in and tried the ImpeachMINT smoothie. WOW. It was delicious! Plus the staff was so helpful. I had to leave a review after years of patronage🧡
This is the type of place you don't hear about on travel shows or tourist blogs. A real, down to earth local sandwich shop slinging great dogs and sandwiches.

The best deli sandwiches! I had a “basic” turkey sandwich but it was so dang good that she must have made it with love and some secret ingredients because it doesn’t even make sense how good it tasted. I got it will all of the toppings and the turkey was actually juicy and flavorful. Same with the Reuben ($2 off on Tuesdays). Husband said it was the best Rueben of his life (I tried it and agree). Instead of eating in the overpriced food court at the museum, hop over and support this local place instead. You will not regret it!
Came in on a Saturday afternoon. Was quickly greeted by 2 friendly guys who quickly made our 2 sandwiches with a smile on their face. Very good food!
Very good food and we were welcomed with great customer service. Found it after visiting museum science and industry

Good sandwiches, the spices and oil they use is really tasty. The staff were pretty friendly and the prices are really reasonable. My one complaint is that the bread is pretty dry, but I like this place better than popular chain sandwich places.

I had a great experience here - I came to this place twice; last week had a really good breakfast.  I like their food, coffee, and service.  It gets so crowded from 11::00 to 13:00, and it's really hard to find a table.  I like their outdoor seating, where you can set and chat conveniently. You should try their almond croissant and apple danish; taste really good.

Ambiance:
- when this place is busy, which is pretty much all the time ;) it gets loud inside from all the people speaking. I overheard people studying for their bio final, and thought I would never be able to study having to speak so loudly to get my partner to hear me. But…. The outside is where it’s at! They have a beautiful outdoor area with tons of seating options. Today, I chose to sit at the communal long table with the planter in the middle. When it’s nice out, I will always sit here.

Staff:
- the staff here are nice and go out of their way to help you. I asked one of the good runners a question that he didn’t know the answer to, and I said that’s okay, don’t worry about it, I’ll check when I go back inside. Little did I know, he found someone inside that came out and answered my question. Now that’s “Disney quality” customer service! (When you don’t know the answer to something, you find out for the customer)

Food:
I was craving soup, so I called ahead and asked what the soup of the day was. I was told chicken with rice. I asked the person on the phone if they liked it, to which they responded that they did. I then asked if I could order it for pickup over the phone and they said I’d have to use one of the online ordering systems because they don’t do phone orders. Instead, I just walked over and ordered in person. Unfortunately, it fortunately (depending on how you look at it), coming in to order led me to spend more than I had intended- haha.
I ordered the chicken and rice soup of the day ($5.95) as well as the Avocado and tomato salad ($11.95).

The chicken soup was tasty. It had just the right amount of veggies and chicken to broth ratio. And it came with three small slices of baguette.

The avocado and tomato salad is an arugula base (my favorite kind of green), and in addition to perfectly ripened avocados and tomatoes, has cotija cheese sprinkled on top and a cilantro dressing. The only let down was the cilantro dressing. I expected something vinegary and more cilantro flavored, but this was sweet. That was definitely not what I had in mind, but I know better now and will ask if the dressings are sweet or not in the future for other salads. Apart from the surprise sweetness, the arugula was wonderfully fresh, without any wilting!

So, long story short, I would not get the salad again, unless I got a different dressing, but I would get the soup. And while I was seated, I saw several other things I want to try in the future… specifically their sandwiches. Those baguettes look so good!

Also, the question I had asked was what came on the goat cheese sandwich because online said paprika and I was like it can’t just be paprika and goat cheese. I think it was an autocorrect because the staff told me it’s peppers! Hahaha. That is something I actually make at home all the time! Roasted red peppers, with goat cheese, and arugula on a baguette. So, that is something I will try in the future!

This is by far my favorite cafe, I love it, but you guys really need to open a second register. This place is so popular that there's a solid line to the back of the dining room every single day. I'll change my review to 5 stars when you open a second register.

I love this place right at the core of UChicago. I recommend the salads and the quiche, also scrambled eggs with the best bacon in the city! Coffee is very well prepared, too. Staff are super friendly. Just mind that this place is usually crowded and sometimes can be a bit noisy and overwhelming. Other than that, it’s one of my favorite spots to have lunch at campus.

Excellent opportunity to have a sandwich before touring Robie House. The place is spotless, has charming, shady outdoor seating plus a dining room, and a variety of food and drink options. From the outdoor seating,, you are looking at the back of the Robie House. It also sits next to a fascinating bookstore, so it is a worthwhile stop in its own right. I had a smoked turkey sandwich, and my SO had a prosciutto and manchengo on a small baguette, both with greens. Coffee also great@

What a cool concept and place- a cafe with something to do Capital One Banking? It's cool and different. 30-50% your orders if you're a Capital One Card Holder. 🙌🏼

It's a legit cafe. Very clean, great coffee.

Service was so friendly and nice. All smiles and warm greetings.

The cafe is modern and sleek. Plenty of seating options.

Have never been in something like this. It's cool. Absolutely 10/10 recommend

Very decent place. They have tables where you can work on, and there's the separate place for actual banking needs. You get 50% off your drinks if you use your capital one card. Very face service as well. Friendly staff.

I absolutely adore this spot and find myself returning frequently. The community here is remarkable - incredibly hospitable and kind-hearted. Big shoutout to all the lovely people. The place is a true gem for the neighborhood and surrounding community. The unique combination of a coffeeshop and bank at this venue has created a sophisticated yet inviting atmosphere that many locals, including myself, have grown to cherish and frequent. My go-to order is the creamy, smooth latte - highly recommended!

I JUST LOVE CAPITAL ONES PRODUCT IT HAS A LOT TO DO WITH CAPITAL ONE APP AND THE CAFES WITH THEIR HOUSED ATM MACHINES. U CAN DO YOUR BANKING, IF U OWN AN CREDIT ACCOUNT WITH THE BANK, WITHDRAW MONEY AND PAY YOUR CAPITAL ONE BILL WITH THE ATM MACHINES. I HAVE TWO ACCOUNTS WITH CAPITAL ONE WHEN  USPS WAS HAVING PROBLEMS DELIVERING MY PAYMENTS ON TIME. THIS BECAME THE OPTIONS AND IT HAS BEEN MY GO TO EVER SENSE. IT ALLOWS U TO PAY YOUR BILL IN REAL TIMES ESPECIALLY IF IT IS PAID OFF BY CASH

This review is to capital one bank not this particular bank location, but long story short I was overcharged by a merchant and provided clear evidence that they overcharged me however capital one disregarded my evidence and reversed my provisional credit and denied my claim and left my account negative while they “reviewed” the situation again, mind you again this situation is a no brainer and its clear evidence, I’ve concluded that their customer service is a joke and does not respect customers time or money. I would not recommend this bank to anyone. You have been warned!

Always a pleasure to come into this Philz. I drive from Michigan Grand Rapids just to come to this Philz. The staff is kind and friendly and totly uphold the Philz coffee standards. Definitely try their Limited time Cold Brew Oatmeal Cookie! It's a new drink to me and I love it!
It's one of the best coffee shops in 53th st - their coffee latte and cappuccino are really good - recommend to try it.
Wonderful single cup drip service. The bold was great as is, thank you.

I recently visited Philz Coffee and had a great experience. The Mocha Tesoro I ordered was delicious and the atmosphere was perfect for a student comfort zone. The free Wi-Fi was a great bonus and the service was polite and helpful. The prices were also very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good cup of coffee At Hyde park.
Page made me the dancing water and it was too good! Lovely place and vibes!

I’m a senior who meets seven or eight other ladies for coffee every Friday morning At the 53rd St. coffee shop. We started coming to your shop a few weeks ago and I have to tell you the customer service that those girls have on Friday mornings that are there from about 10:30 to 12:30 are unbelievable. But they’re sweet, they have great manners, their customer service skills are impeccable, and most of all they’re so nice to us. I just wanted to thank you because it’s such a pleasure coming to your store my daughter and her partner *Now coming in for coffee because I told him how good it was. Thank you it’s nice to have a place to go for a bunch of seniors just to chitchat on a Friday morning, we appreciate you, thank you so much for your staff and what they do.
Regards,
Helen Perryman

New to the area and decided to stop in for some coffee, I’m NOT a morning person and wanted to grab and go BUT was VERY intrigued by a barista named MEG! Very calming, patient and fast! I will be returning for my morning cup she was so inviting and walked me through the entire experience as well as asking if it was my first time here as she saw I looked confused, I love how she payed attention to me and made my experience very smooth.. reviewing because the world needs more people like this and the coffee was amazing she insisted on steaming my cream instead of allowing me to use the creamer that had been sitting out .. very unique! 5 stars!

The place is overrated and overpriced to my taste. We came here a few times for coffee, and every time it was overheated to the point that I couldn’t touch the cup 🥵. Lattes had almost no foam, and almond milk latte had super weird texture, like if the milk wend bad 🤨(picture attached). And that’s for 5.75 per 12 oz cup + tip. The service is ok.

I hope their food is better than their coffee, otherwise I don’t see why people are coming here. You’ll get better coffee for better price in literally every other place in the neighborhood.

This place is amazing! I am so glad that I stumbled across it on google. As a college student, it was very nice and cozy to study. The baristas were very friendly and helpful introducing me to the place. Food and coffee was superb. I will be returning on the regular for more study sessions!

If you're looking for a place to chill and get to know your neighbors better look no further, but if you're a coffee lover this place will be very disappointing to you. My family has tried the coffee on multiple occasions to give it a fair shot but each time the coffee was either very weak, burnt or just plain bland. Save your money, have coffee at home or of you're still on the hunt for a South side coffee spot that has a warm community feeling, ample space to work plus a great coffee bar drive further south to Kusanya for a yummy strong cup of their Ethiopian blend.

Experience:
There was a line of two people ahead of me which went really quickly.
When I got to the front, I asked if the teas were just a tea bag and water, not lattes, and she said yes, so I ordered a coffee. I paid and she handed me a cup. I turned around and there was a coffee station where you pour your own coffee into your cup and add your cream/milk, and put on your lid.

Drink:
I my light brewed coffee around 3pm.
The coffee was a warm. Now, I don't actually want to scale myself, so warm is fine, but not this kinda warm. This is like just over room temp. When I added cream, it was room temp.
The flavor was okay, but I question how often they fill up the coffee.
I blame myself for not saying anything at the time, but there was a long line of people after me and I was in a rush to get to class, so I took  my warmish coffee and left.

The staff:
Seemed unhappy to be there. The girl behind the counter seemed annoyed at my question about tea.

The cost:
I think the cup of coffee was about $3.45 or so. This seems a bit much when you can get a fresh cup from another place on campus. I'm not sure why the drip coffee is more expensive here. Some other items- like some of the sandwiches seemed more reasonable.

The staff in this place has always been cold. It was fine to me as nothing went wrong. But today, when I used my credit card to pay, the staff did not see the card on my hand and kept asking which payment I chose. The environment is noisy. I intepreted as I stood in front of the wrong credit card machine as this place had several (the fact that I, who is at the same position every time, kept being ordered by staff to use different card machines are also ridiculous; one machine for one position; why it isn't the rule here?). So, I kept switching places and felt confused as I never saw a payment on the credit card machine. This was a problem that could be solved until the staff questioned me, suggesting I was the one at fault. I should really just leave as I am so pissed that I feel full. I will never go back to this place during my time at Uchicago. I always keep my word.
If you’re in a rush, I recommend this place for lunch. It’s a great restaurant to take your quick break, and you can enjoy a nice view from your table.

I've always seen Prets downtown but never actually went to one until they opened a location in Reynolds Club. It's a great place to grab a quick bite that is conveniently located—right across the street from the library and within a 7 minute walk from anywhere on North campus. Prices are a bit expensive relative to other on-campus locations, but I appreciate that they use organic ingredients, freshly prepare their food items each day, and also donate any food items that are left unsold at the end of each day.

Really extravagant location to eat at at University of Chicago which feels more like you are eating on the set of Harry Potter than in a college dinning hall. This is contrasted against the very collegiate atmosphere of students eating and studying together with computers at relatively new feeling tables and attached eateries. Would have loved to see this location at night all lit up on the inside or with the fireplaces going.

Yea, these are great donuts. The chocolate glazed cake donut was one of the best cake donuts I've ever had -- light, moist cakey, but not overly dense and sugary. The chocolate glaze tasted creamy and smooth. I also had an old fashioned, which was also delicious and buttery but the sweetness of it was too much for me to finish. Enjoyed the latte and the general ambiance. Seems like a great place to work remotely or just have a snack.

Omg this is a must try donut shop. I entered Stan’s this morning around 6:15ish and the young lady behind the counter was so nice. She greeted me with I smile and ask how she could help. I shared with her this was my 1st time in the store & I need a moment to browser the menu. So she continued helping took other customers while I was decided what I wanted.

Once I made a decision I placed my order and she was very helpful with answering my questions and serving me. Her great customer service made  me feel warm & welcomed. It’s nothing like receiving great  service with a smile.

I ordered 1/2 dozen of standard donuts and 1/2 dozen of specialty donuts and a mango dragon fruit Stan’s refresher and let me tell you it was absolutely delicious. I’m at work wired and ready.

I also enjoyed the carrot cake donut it was so fresh and delicious. It even had pieces of carrot in it. Now that’s a donut. Made with love and tasted amazing.

Thanks Darryl for being the highlight of my day. I’ll certainly be back to visit real soon.

Your girl Sunshine
From Let’s Do It Tours
the pistachio matcha latte tasted kind of weird not gonna lie. the breakfast burrito was okay, but a little over burned. cute place to hang!

Actually amazing. Make sure you get in before 4 if you want to grab a vegan donut! The coffee here is really, really good. (Surprisingly good, as I usually have low expectations for coffee from non-dedicated coffee shops.)

Great service, really cute decor, and centrally located in Hyde Park.

No clue why I keep giving Stan's a chance. The prices are exorbitant and the donuts just aren't very good. They're very bready and the bread is kinda plain, and not very sweet. The creams and compotes, on the other hand, are overly sweet, as if to compensate. I wouldn't recommend Stan's to anyone, but I know a ton of people swear by it.

EXTREME PRICE GOUGING HAPPENING! Employees don't actually have items priced in their system. They add random items to up the price to whatever they want. Avoid this business at all costs.  At least list the correct prices, then we will be willing to pay the price. We don't want you "deciding" the price in front of us!
An overpriced on campus mini mart.  Unless you are on a student meal plan and have 'flex dollars' to spend, it really isn't a great place to go because it is so overpriced.
Best Nutter Butter and Chicken Pot Pie on the planet.
Good place to have a quick snack and meal
Closed during summer / school breaks

Looks like Sweet Drip is back open! Spoke with the owner who said their hours are 10am-8pm for now, but the sign on their door says they are having a soft opening on May 5th and their hours will change to 8am-9pm. I had pistachio tres leches and it was yummy!
The chocolate lovers crepe is very tasty, and the lattes and Turkish coffee are very good. The owners are also very friendly and helpful.

My daughter and I needed a place to rest before going to O'hare airport to fly back to Kansas. Beautiful atmosphere and we enjoyed a scoop of ice cream and an iced coffee. We found an awesome place after walking along the Lake. The owner was very nice and we would recommend.

Originally came in for just tea but left with a slice of red velvet cake, scoop of cheesecake flavored ice cream and a caramel coffee! We were greeted with the sweetest mini boss (daughter of the owner) as well as the owner and his wife who provided such amazing customer service. They were very welcoming and helpful.

The environment was very clean, welcoming, bright and beautifully decorated. They even had a grass wall with a cute sign for all do your Instagram and TikTok moments.

The coffee was delicious and flavorful, the cake was rich and the ice cream was to die for, you can tell that it’s made fresh and in house.

10/10 would recommend and will be back! You all have a loyal customer out of me.

Came in for a latte and left with treats for my family (tres leche & funnel cake). Everyone was really nice and the latte was nice and strong, great mid day pick me up. Excited to try the Turkish coffee next time.

Love the ambiance here, great place to meet up with friends 💕
I ordered a latte from here and it was ok 👍🏼  next time I’ll try an iced coffee instead of hot… There’s plenty of room to drink and enjoy with friends or family…

The staff are always distract, and make the overpriced drinks pretty badly. Overcharge on accident multiple times and overall not worth the money. Sucks the location is great, otherwise I wouldn't come back

Great place to start a day of museums and sight seeing! Our drinks were made quickly and perfectly, even being at drinking temperature (which was really nice). We enjoyed the ambiance as well and the friendly staff!
Always a vibe. Vietnamese cold brew my favorite . New food items and they are pretty good. Hate they changed the bread tho. Definitely enjoyed the old one

Summary:
- High prices
- Wrong prices presented
- Very very small portion of greens

I came and took one of the printed menus as I was standing in line. Chose to get an egg&cheese sandwich (shown as $6.00) and a side of greens (shown as $3.50). I also got an Americano. I get to the counter and see that the prices are higher. Much higher. For the sandwich, 8$, and for the greens, $6! That is 25% more for the sandwich and and almost double for the greens. So I ask the cashier about it and she says "oh yes, that's not updated, you have this one up here for reference" and points to the menu above her head. To me, that is not good service. First, please don't present false prices. Print a new menu, correct it with a pen, anything. By the time I got to the cashier, I just wanted to order, so I accepted the prices and hoped that at least it will be worth it. The whole order, befote tip, summed to a little over $20.

I get my coffee, which was ok. Water tap doesn't work, so I ask for water. Water was warm. I get my sandwich and greens. The sandwich is what I expected. A small bun with eggs and cheese. Wouldn't pay $8 again for it, but it was ok. But the greens... A tiny container with the dressing container inside taking even more room. The amount is ridiculous. $6 for such a small amount of simple greens.

I wouldn't recommend going here for more than a coffee or a muffin. You won't get your money's worth.

Side note -
Yes, I understand there is inflation, covid recovery, staffing issues, etc. I understand some of this place's costs are higher. But please, 25% to almost 100% increase? That seems greedy to me. Plus, presenting the wrong prices is manipulative in my opinion.

I hope the management of this branch takes this into account.

In the picture, the tiny container of greens.

name: Reva and David Logan Center for the Arts

reviews.text: Came here for a recital and I'll gladly be back! The parking lot is open to the public weekdays after 4p and all day weekends, so I'll definitely use that for future visits. But street parking isn't too hard to come by either. There are no restrooms on the 9th floor, where the recital was held, and only single occupant bathrooms on 8th.
I came to see the Black Comic Book Art . Their works are amazing! My grandson wanted to check out the exhibit. The prints and posters were amazing. I plan on purchasing one for him.
A GREAT, SPECTACULAR  venue  to  showcase performing  arts,I had a great time .Everyone  was fantastic.

The performance hall is an excellent place for chamber music and other small to medium sized groups. Great for jazz concerts also, minus the beverages. The cafe also hosts jazz sessions, and beverages are available. The performance penthouse has breathtaking views. Nearby parking. Nothing not to like!
I was only in the theater and it was very nice. Good acoustics and comfortable seats.

name: The University of Chicago Bookstore & Cafe

reviews.text:
The Lavender London Fog Tea is a life-changer!!!

Wonderful service, remarkable products and truly welcoming environment. Highly recommend visiting!!
I went twice. The tea was okay, but the place was simply toooooo hot. Heating was on even in a warm day. Perhaps okay for grabbing some drink, but not good to stay.

The coffee shop in the bookstore gets 5/5 for being the only place open on Memorial Day. 🥳
Coffee ok, place ok, burn it’s open!
Also, the power and USB outlets at the tables are super useful, thanks!

I'm Japanese.
I visited to buy it to commemorate my study abroad.
As the name of the store suggests, many items named after the University of Chicago are on display.
However, some products were not properly inspected and had scratches.

In other words, I think the Japanese inspection was polite.
Tried to buy a sweatshirt for my daughter due to sudden drop temperature and very windy on May 27. Don't have that much smaller size available

name: Cobb Coffee Shop
address: Cobb Lecture Hall, South Ellis Avenue, Chicago

reviews.text: We held a non profit board meeting here, and it worked out very well. We drank a truly ludicrous amount of coffee! Great art, great atmosphere, great looking cheese plate (can't comment on the taste as I'm a vegan). Will definitely go back next time I'm in Chicago!

My favourite coffee shop on campus. Haven't actually had the coffee, but they have the largest tea selection around and their food selection is wonderful—I particularly love the vegan chocolate chip cookies, and they also have lots of dishes from De Rice, Snail Thai, Soul Vegan, Rajun Cajun, The Nile, etc. Sometimes their music gets a little loud and confusing but most of the time I really enjoy every song.

Great music, sometimes coffee and food are also great. Not great lighting.
I wouldn't come here to do homework.
I would come here if had to.
I would probably come if I didn't have to.
Convenient, chill coffee shop. Offers ready made food. Coffee options are limited, but the coffee shop offers other options like pizza and a big selection of drinks.
I saw one of their employees  actually assault a customer. drip coffee is also atrocious. 3/10 not enough hickies.
Absolutely worth a visit if you are into vintage soul, funk, R&B, hip hop. Also have a small section for reissues and a decent selection of other genres. Shop owner was very nice and a cool guy.

I dropped in for the first time today not knowing what to expect, and found a great addition to the collective of record stores already in the Chicago area. There's a fun & welcoming vibe to the place as soon as you walk in. The selection isn't as big as others, but it has well-curated collections of soul, R&B, hip-hop, jazz, and 12-inch singles. This place is a DJ's dream. For the collectors out there - I flipped the bins and found a few legitimate holy grails, that were reasonably priced. The only reason I didn't grab them myself is because I already had them. Visit with confidence.
Came to a Pass the Aux event here and loved it. So many great souls just sharing and listening to great music. Love that they sell coffee here too and there’s a little place to chill in the back.
Great collection of old school vinyls. This will be a perfect place to start your collection if you're leaning more towards vintage and also the in-store DJ was very good as well.
Played a show here a few weeks ago. Great folks, great record and tape selection and their calendar is full of positive events for their community.

I know the menu rotates, but the brussel sprout flatbread was one of the best things I’ve had in a while.

And the “Feeling Toasted”  cocktail was so lovely.

Atmosphere was great, service was helpful and friendly, and the live dj at happy hour was working the room. Sad they’re not open on the weekends. Definitely, definitely will be back.

This cafe is such a vibe. The furniture, design, layout is impeccable. There’s a place to sit and work on your computer or lounge and talk with your friends or sit and read a book in a nook or just be emo if you’re feeling moody.

But let’s talk about coffee. Bro! Their drip coffee sent me. A fiesta of complexity in my mouth I tell ya. I was told that they feature beans from various black owned businesses. This one is from Bamenda Coffee: The Chicago Dark Roast. Don’t skimp on their breakfast sandwich either. It won’t disappoint. Get those avo and roasted red pepper add ons, too!

Just note that they have a limited menu at this time, which is my personal preference so that’s gr8. Also, complementary Topo Chico?! No way.

All that said, follow them on insta. Get to know their story. That’s the best part.
Love the atmosphere. Really nice cafe for remote work. I also love the fact that they have the maple walnut milk as an alternative to dairy milk. It does something extra special for my chai late.

Great place to work or study from quality wifi available and all the good vibes. I had the ube latte with oat milk no espresso because I don’t drink coffee and it was delicious and so pretty. I also got the ube cookie and the veggie sandwich at lunch it was very tasty and perfect for the vegetarian garlic girls. Vegan option would be to get that without cheese btw. Very affordable music is vibey and chill, no too loud had a work call from upstairs there is also a space downstairs to work with less distractions. The upstairs seems pretty accessible and the restroom but idk ADA specifics wouldn’t be able to go downstairs or to the patio.
I went on a Thursday night. The vibe was awesome & the drinks were fantastic. Cliff & the band did a great job. Me and my friends had a great time and I look forward to visiting again.

This place has the worst costumer service. There is this lady named Jennifer who has the worst way to treat costumers. She closes before the actual closing time and also takes orders and doesn't notify costumers they are out of soup. Then she basically kicked me out. Was not the only person having issues with her. Also Nick the guy before me had an altercation with Jennifer as well. Management should really look into making some changes because she is not what Panera is identified as.

Maisha Oliver at Kabob-It station inside of the U of C Hutchinson Cafe has by far the best pineapple chicken kabob & salmon kabob ever. The meal was so flavorful and delicious. The mango habanero sauce was absolutely divine. You can tell the food is made with love. I also had some salad w/ lemon zest dressing that was pretty good as well. Try it for yourself you won’t be disappointed. My lunch was phenomenal today and I will be back.

Ca Phe Da. Unfortunately the food is just not good. The bahn mis are salty. The meat in the pho is tough. In addition, the food is expensive. Nice location and service. Just not worth it in my opinion.

Simple tables in a very sunny and spacious setting, funny name, good food, but I think its overpriced. Their "Yucatan Turkey" sandwich and salads are pretty good. It's also nice to study here if you don't mind the noise

The Impossible  burger is very good. I recommend the brioche bun as well. The only thing missing is french fries. The burger has a variety of toppings and is excellent with or without the bun. Highly recommended but a little pricey.

Worst customer service experience. No matter what time of day staff is loud, rude and more interested in talking to each other than taking or preparing orders. Thank God for Farmers Fridge down the hallway.

We went there for my birthday brunch this year. What a gem! Friendly staff, delicious food, unique artwork, good music playing from the speakers, cool items for sale. It's a whole vibe. Hope to be back.

I came to Carver 47 to honor my good friend Warren bc he recently passed away and this was his favorite coffee shop. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted with such beautiful smiles, soulful music and fresh flowers! I was sold on the vibes alone. I ordered the catfish and yellow grits and honey, it was bomb! I also ordered one of the most popular smoothies(can’t remember the name) and it was delicious. My food came out quickly and was popping hot, flavorful and fresh! I’m not from Chicago, but when I visit again, I’ll definitely be coming back!
Such a wonderful hidden in plain site gem!  The food is yummy and the people are friendly and the vibes are just phenomenal!

Beautiful! When you walk in, stand there for a quick second and take a look around. Beautifully decorated! I had to mention that first.  They have lots to offer, but the catfish and grits stuck out immediately. I also have one heck of a sweet tooth, so I got the apple danish  (heated) as well. Omg,  so I took pictures of my dine-in plate and Danish. The other pictures are of a second visit to go.  Simple amazing!  The catfish and grits were seasoned to perfection. I've been meaning to try other things, but I'm hooked on the fish and grits. Oh yeah, the London Fog tea is very good. I highly recommend this place. You can do takeout, or enjoy your meal there. They have like a family style table and also seating in the window if you want a view while you dine. Enjoy!

I have been SLEEPING on this place. The atmosphere is so relaxed and welcoming. The food is delicious!! I had the fried catfish sandwich and it was mouthwatering. Now that I have stopped in I will be here all the time. There are lots of yummy looking menu items and it is such a nice little spot to do some reading or work!

Food options looked delectable! Trying a super cute mochi donut for them first time. Drinks menu offers so much variety! Only problem is narrowing down what to get. :-) Service was efficient. Lots of seating. Music fun, but not too loud. Really enjoyed my experience!!! Will return soon!!!!
I generally enjoy the matcha strawberry —— if I could change anything, it's to lower the sweetness level.
Nyiisha  was the best person ever! I went with my wife and she gave us an excellent service

The place itself was very clean and the service was very fast, however the lukewarm tea with the hard well done steak-esque boba did not go very well. After two sips I lifted up my leg for a fart and genuinely almost had liquid diarrhea in the seat. Had to dump it out, immediately had diarrhea on the drive back home and made it just in time.
Great variety and unique packaging. I did the Dalgona match with Boba and it was heavenly. Will definitely visit again when am in Chicago

name: Café Logan
address: Logan Center for the Arts, East 60th Street, Chicago

reviews.text: I ordered a latte and and a panini. They were both standard. This is a U of C campus cafe but it’s open to the public. Lots of students & faculty. Great Wi-Fi. Really good place to get some work done. Also great customer service! The ladies behind the counter were very nice.

My first visit to Cafe Logan was solid. It's spacious and bright (floor to ceiling windows along the east wall and part of the north wall) with Wi-Fi and plenty of seats, tables and outlets. I ordered a coffee - it was a nice cup of coffee at a decent price (maybe a little on the high end). The best part was Chicago artist Nikko Washington's exhibit on the cafe walls. I assume (hope!) that they rotate exhibits in the cafe. It's a really nice feature that makes this cafe unique (thus, the 4 star review). I'd probably come back, particularly if there are art exhibits in the cafe that interest me.
Me and my friend came to this location while they were opening and we were denied in service. They should close at 4pm but they didn’t want to make a coffee for us at 3:35 pm

Not good..overpriced. I walk throughout the campus and have lunch but after today, I will not be back.

Edit: they've switched vendors or at least updated the menu. They now offer side salads..sushi..more beverage..dessert. I don't want to talk about the prices because i still think they are pricey compared to the other cafes on campus to the proportions. Nice open and modern sitting. My first review was on the food which was TERRIBLE but I've updated it since I've gone back. They stopped selling chicken salad too which was pretty good at one point.
Pretty nice good, but a bit expensive for what it is. Also a lack of vegetarian options.

I've ordered the tuna melt and pecan roll before and had to get it again. I also decided to try something new, the Biscuit Bowl was amazing! Lots of flavor, the biscuit was fluffy, flaky, and flavorful. Gravy was so good too! I had no idea it would come in that kind of bowl but I loved it! It made it easier to get everything in one bite. This is a place you go to and have to try everything on the menu because it's just that good.
I ordered a brisket grilled cheese from here and when I bit into the sandwich it was stale and hard. On my second bite I realized there was a piece of paper in my food!
Finding a booth near an outlet may be a challenge, but otherwise very solid place. Would recommend. Grilled cheese was fye. Playlist was jamming 👌

The green smoothie, banana bread French toast and build your own croissant sandwich with egg and bacon 🥓!! 😋 Yum.

I was visiting from DC to spend time with family and my mom recommended we go to Robust. She shared how she appreciates the location - not quite in Hyde Park but not in the hood either.

She lives in a food desert and said that she comes to this place when she needs a balanced meal. I’m thankful she has this place to go to! My husband and I enjoyed as well 💕 I wanted to try everything! Next time I’ll get a donut 😄

First time here and it will Not be my last ! This place is full of good food, good people and good vibes. They serve breakfast all day and that’s a winner for me. I had the Grits bowl and it was really different as well as really good. Never thought to pile everything in a bowl of grits  . My Chi tea latte was great and hit the spot as the weather is cooling down some… I got a peak at how to play chess which was cool too. I would have given 5 stars but they could use some extra help with cleaning as the tables were dirty and too many of gnats joined in on my meeting 🤷🏽‍♀️

name: Grounds of Being: The Divinity School Coffee Shop

reviews.text:
CASH only!

MENU:
Great coffee--I believe the least expensive on campus--and some yummy premade meals.

Coffee - 8oz = $1
I like the LSD blend.

CAFE:
The place is pretty small but usually packed with people. It's located in the basement of Swift, so it is also rather dark. Honestly, the vibe makes me feel like I'm in a wood laden tavern in Europe... which I love. However, the darkness is not conducive for my studying; so, I usually grab a coffee and bounce.

LOCATION:
When you walk into Swift, you walk in a diagonal to the left. You will see an opening to a stairwell. You descend the stairs and then turn to the left and descend a few more. It's straight ahead.
There is also an elevator to the basement; when you enter Swift it's on the right.

SERVICE:
I've found the staff is usually in good spirits and friendly. However, every now and again, you get someone who doesn't seem to be having a good day. It happens to all of us.

I think it’s the best coffee in hyde park! love the drink quality and the lunches are great

Remember to bring cash!

A great student-run local coffee shop! They have an array of food, but the selection has been the same for many years, would be nice to change it up a bit. Payment is cash-only, which I can totally understand, but sometimes it does mean I have to make a different decision. The coffee is great! Lastly, it's often quite crowded so tough to get a spot to sit

Best coffee on campus? Cheapest coffee on campus? Tastiest lunch on campus? (sourced from local Hyde Park restaurants?) Cheapest lunch on campus? Punniest name in campus? The answer to these questions is all the same, and it’s grounds of being. I don’t care if y’all are cash only, eating here is just too good.

Definitely the best coffee place on campus. And if you bring your own mug, they let you refill for a dollar. Also, they have food from a variety of restaurants around Hydepark. The price is pretty reasonable compared to other places around campus. They only take cash though which is inconvenient sometimes.

Nestled within the scholarly sanctuary of the University of Chicago lies the vibrant heartthrob of caffeinated indulgence—Harper Cafe. This delightful haven not only serves up a mean cup of Joe but also sprinkles it with a hefty dose of charm and charisma that could make even the most caffeine-resistant soul reconsider their allegiance to tea!

The moment you step into Harper Cafe, you're greeted by a symphony of grinding beans and the enticing aroma of freshly brewed coffee that could tempt even the most devout non-coffee drinkers. But what truly makes this place shine brighter than a student's eureka moment is its fantastic troupe of baristas.

These baristas aren't just coffee wizards; they're like caffeinated unicorns sprinkling joy and laughter with each cappuccino they craft. With smiles as warm as the coffee they brew, they'll memorize your order faster than you can say "double-shot, extra foam, non-fat latte with a twist." They make multitasking seem like an art form as they effortlessly juggle orders, spill jokes, and spread cheer faster than you can say "espresso."

Their charisma is infectious, creating an atmosphere that makes you feel like you've stumbled into the friendliest coffee party on campus. Whether you're a sleep-deprived student seeking an all-nighter companion or a professor in need of an intellectual stimulant, these baristas cater to everyone with equal parts of wit and warmth.

And the coffee? Oh, the coffee! It's not just a beverage; it's a symphony of flavors dancing upon your taste buds. From velvety lattes to bold Americanos, each sip feels like a caffeinated hug embracing your soul, whispering, "You got this, go conquer the world!"

In a place where deadlines loom like storm clouds and assignments pile up like a caffeine crash waiting to happen, Harper Cafe and its wonderful baristas serve as a beacon of light, providing not just coffee but a sanctuary of smiles, laughter, and the perfect blend of camaraderie and caffeine.

So, dear coffee enthusiasts and aficionados of jovial banter, if you find yourself wandering the hallowed halls of the University of Chicago, do yourself a favor and pay a visit to Harper Cafe. It's where the coffee is exquisite, the ambiance is infectious, and the baristas are the real MVPs of caffeinated euphoria.
Great syrup options for girlies that want a rose and lavender latte. Unfortunately they don't serve alcohol or sell the gallons of milk they display in their fridges.
Student cafe. Used to be the Common Knowledge Cafe. Standard UC coffee place. Tables are nice and big for working. Comfy nap chairs but it's always noisy.
Friendly staff and good selection
NOTE:  not open during Summer or inter-terms.

Atmosphere is great. This is really a make it work coffee shop. The views are great and the plants look well kept.

Pop in for one of the events and learn something to take back home to your family

When I walked into the space I felt a great sense of wholeness.

It was a welcoming environment for people to enjoy themselves comfortably.

Learn about green living, learn more about culture and community.

Phyllis- Hands of love -Skincare/ Relaxation/ Nails

Great place to host events.

Love the promotion of sustainability.
Great resource space. Check it out!

One of the misleading aspects of this app is that someone can not visit a location but only pass by and it registers as a visitation. That's ok. This is a great app that does a good public service. I have not been to the Hammond library so I can't comment. I have to give a library, a place of learning a decent rating however because it's a positive contribution to society.
Beautiful library. I don't attend the U of C and I just got a day pass for free at the entrance.

I love the reg always such a delightful experience! I enjoy going to complete my hours worth of homework! At times though I would say the wifi is quite laggy but that would be my only complaint! At times I feel like I myself am a scientist writing my papers while at the library! If you are can I would totally recommend stopping by the cafe during your trip it is a must! The food is very pricey but part of the ultimate experience! I would like to talk about as well the wonderful views at night if you check out the bookstacks you can see the Mansueto library with its lovely architecture! I love this location very much!!!! Please check out the images provided!!!
honestly im surprised wifi can actually be this slow..

My second home, the Reg is the best spot on campus hands down. You can fully lock in by secluding yourself in the cubicle, or chill and get some work done with friends at a table. You can also take nice comfortable naps on the plump chairs! It is simply the best place to study since when you look around at your surroundings, you see other hardworking students grinding their behinds off and that is highkey motivating!

This library is a magnificent architecture. At least I can only say about the outside. You'll read that the dome is open to the public BUT it is not. Even after you find your way to the correct corridor, the Regenstien library (where they give access passes) have strict restrictions for the public. Even if you're a student in Chicago you must demonstrate/prove a "research" need to be in the library.
I drove nearly an hour (would be close to 2 hours on CTA) to be told I can't go in, although I've read on plenty of sites that they have certain hours open to the public.
My favorite library on campus! Good atmosphere. Also, the lounge across the hall has very comfortable couches.
Great library.
Philip Glass used to hang out here.
Great place to study!!

name: Chicago Theological Seminary - Lapp Learning Commons

reviews.text: Retiring after serving 21 years, over 4 decades, in 3 different branches and 5 components, you would think that Obama would appreciate the sacrifices made; apparently not. I requested a PLOA and so did several people I know, yet after 8 requests spanning over 3 years, nothing was ever sent. Disgraceful!

This is a hideous building inside what Used to be an Olmsted designed Park. Covered in stone, lacking windows, obelisk like.
It's located in a migratory flyway and will cause collisions with birds. They chopped down over a thousand trees - for this?
I'm excited to see that construction is progressing.

Will the Obamas use their multimillion dollar fortune to protect the housing of the Woodlawn, Washington Park, South Shore communities as their rents and property taxes skyrocket?

Is there any attempt to offset the massive environmental pollution and destruction caused by this privately owned building that's destroyed acres of public park land and forest?

I've already seen the pollution's impact on Jackson Park's lake. The hundreds of trees, many old growth, destroyed. The building itself blocking off major bird migration routes. It's truly criminal that they chose to build this on public park land (given to them for free by Lori) when there are countless acres of abandoned and undeveloped land across the south side. I remember there was a group of locals pushing for this to be on a vast stretch of empty land in Washington Park, where it would've been replacing concrete and cheap private land rather than destroying a vibrant ecosystem and public park.

I would love to see this result in resources flooding into the local community, as it was originally framed/sold. God knows no one else has been investing in poor south side neighborhoods. If the Obamas really believe in what they say, they should be taking massive steps to protect local housing and pour resources into the community. They damn well have the money.

As it is now though, I can only see this being a massive hub of tourism, pollution, and gentrification that's already been spreading out from Hyde Park. Most of the housing on the south side is now owned by corporations, who will have no qualms evicting longtime residents to take on white folks who can pay three times as much. We've already seen it happening across Hyde Park, Bronzeville, Morgan Park, and other historic south side communities.

If anyone with a heart and some influence sees this, please tell the Obamas. Whatever their intentions, this is going to be really bad for the local poor black communities and the environment unless they step up right now to change how they're doing this.
Very excited to see the construction finally underway. Will be a wonderful asset to the area!

name: The Power Latent In Man, Inc.

reviews.text: It's a bit of a walk from Drexel and 57th. You have to go almost directly across from Comers Children's HSP ER entrance walking thru the small parking lot, meander through to the 2nd set of stairs on your left, keep going until you see Peaches @University in a window, go around to the left of that building and go right in.  The university had a computer class for my tween daughter and it took a bit of trying to find. I took a star off as Google didn't describe the intense searching like you're playing that Pokemon on your mobile phone. 😆

I love this library and I appreciate that they allow outside students access to the location. The library staff are polite and professional. I go there mostly for the lighting and it's never crowded. You can always find a quiet corner.
Quiet library for science and technology with comfortable chairs. Wish the windows were larger so that they can take in more sun light.
Great renovations that make this space inviting, great for both individual studying and group work, and a comfortable spot to be in.
this is hands down my favorite place to study 10/10

name: Film Studies Center
address: Cobb Lecture Hall, 5811 South Ellis Avenue, Chicago

name: The Joe and Rika Mansueto Library

reviews.text: Beautiful space to study!!! It is a quiet zone so be ready to get some looks if you’re being noisy! Aside from that, this place is great to do some readings on a physical book, not so much on a screen device bc the sun coming through makes it impossible to see

Of all the underground, robot-controlled libraries I've been to, this one is the best. The ovaloid shape vaguely recalls our experience of the womb, while the climate control makes it at least as comfortable as most normal libraries. If you prefer libraries that are mostly above-ground and shaped with more straight lines, the Regenstein, next door, might be more to your taste.
Excellent modern design with glass ceiling for library.
Relaxing, quiet, and scenic place to work! Only downfall is that the temperature gets uncomfortably low making it difficult to focus. If they could fix that issue, they'd be perfect.
Amazing library

This is a great library. It's never too busy and they have a huge kids' section. They have weekly events for kids and toddlers, such as storytime, Legos, chess, and more. I think the architecture of this building is also pretty cool. The hours are good except Sunday, but that's typical. Free street parking is typically available right out front. I will definitely be back.
Great building and pleasant staff. It is small but very easy to navigate. There are no quiet areas, though and it tends to be loud.

The Blackstone Library Branch is a great neighborhood library branch, and its children's section is particularly noteworthy. Although it is a small neighborhood branch, they have made great use of the facilities to offer a welcoming space with books, games, and toys to foster children's learning and engagement. The programming is wonderful. We were able to attend a free outing to the Museum of Science & Industry hosted by the library for children and their families. The librarians are engaging and helpful, taking the time to listen to children's interests and then find materials that suit their needs. On a cold winter day, spending the afternoon with there with my four-year old reading, playing, and asking questions and learning how to find answers is one of my favorite ways to spend the day.

We utilize the children area very often. It's a good resource for young kids to spend time in the neighborhood, especially if you don't have a car and have limited options to explore other libraries. The play area doesn't offer as many toys as other libraries though, most likely due to the space being on the smaller side.

Tried to give this older library a chance but was blatantly disrespected by a tall Caucasian woman in her late thirties. Walked into the children’s section of the library and this woman comes out and turns all the lights off after she looked at me and my sister in the eyes. This place is already small and and out of date but to add a nasty attitude on top. I genuinely hope the she doesn’t not work with the African American children there. The only pleasant part of this place are the two other women I saw today.

Your quintessential Oxbridge-inspired gothic-styled grand hall university reading room (Arley D Cathey) is located here on the 3rd floor, next to the bustling Harper Cafe by the elevator in the east tower of the building. The statue just across the road toward Midway Plaisance looks like Kant at first but I guess they all fashioned their hair and clothing very similarly to each other back then
An interesting quiet place made to study or wonder.
This is my favorite place to read a book. Gorgeous study area, gothic architecture, and little noise. I highly recommend visiting or coming here to get important stuff done!
Delivers on the gothic-revival Oxbridge replica reading room experience you would expect from this ivy covered campus.
Beautiful reading room on the 3rd floor.
Tell the security guard girl lady i am sorry for flirting with her i apologize for that love and like Quintin Hall who was on the legal help firm and WGN news states and fox32 news
The librarian was very helpful. The atmosphere inside is so conducive for concentration. I like this place

Best librarians and staff in the city! Great children's librarian as well. A lot of family-focused community events. Facilities aren't as updated as some other branches, especially the restrooms and the children's section.
Staff are very nice and helpful
I liked it and anyone near should definitely go in because the staff is extremely helpful with what you may need when looking up something or needing help with anything
